2.t: They quarrel about the great news

4.t: (What they think is certainly despicable!). They will soon come to know (the reality).

5.t: Yes, indeed, before long they will learn all about it.

6.t: Have We not made the earth as a place to rest

7.t: and the mountains as pegs (to anchor the earth)?

8.t: Have We not created you in pairs,

9.t: made sleep for you to rest,

10.t: made the night as a covering,

11.t: and the day as time for you to make a living?

12.t: Have We not made seven strong heavens above you,

14.t: and sent down heavy rains from the clouds

17.t: The Day of Judgment will certainly be the final appointment.

18.t: On that day the trumpet will be sounded and you will come (to Us) in huge groups.
18.tr: Yauma yun-fakhu fis soori fataa-toona afwaaja

19.t: The heavens will have openings like doors.

20.t: The mountains will be driven away and become like mirages.

21.t: Hell will lie in wait (for its prey).

22.t: It will be a place of return

23.t: for the rebellious ones and they will live therein for ages.

24.t: They will not feel cold nor taste any drink
24.tr: Laa ya-zooqoona feeha bar-daw walaa sharaaba

26.t: as a fitting recompense for their deeds.

27.t: They did not expect such a Judgment

29.t: However, We have recorded everything in a book.

30.t: (They will be told), "Suffer, We shall only increase the torment for you".

31.t: The pious ones will be triumphant.

32.t: They will have gardens and vineyards,

33.t: maidens with pears-shaped breasts who are of equal age (to their spouses)

35.t: They will not hear therein any unnecessary words or lies.
35.tr: Laa yasma'oona fiha lagh-waw walaa kizzaba

36.t: This will be their reward from your Lord, a favor from Him and a recompense for their deeds.

37.t: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. He is the Beneficent God and no one will be able to address Him.
37.tr: Rabbis samaa-waati wal-ardi Wa-maa baina-humar rahmaani laa yam-likoona minhu khitaaba

38.t: On that day, the Spirit and the angels who stand in lines will not speak except those whom the Beneficent God has permitted, and he will speak the right words.
38.tr: Yauma yaqoo-mur roohu wal-malaa-ikatu saf-fal laa yatakallamoona ill-laa man azina lahur rahmaanu Wa-qaala sawaaba

39.t: That will be the Day of the Truth. So let those who want seek refuge from their Lord.
39.tr: Zaalikal yaumul haqqu faman shaa-at ta-khaaza ill-laa rabbihi ma-aaba

40.t: We have warned you of the approaching torment. On that day, a person will see what his hands have committed. A disbeliever will say, "Would that I had been dust".
40.tr: In-naa anzar-naakum azaaban qareebaiy yauma yan-zurul marr-u maa qaddamat yadaahu Wa-ya-qoolul kaafiru yaa-lai-tanee kuntu turaaba
